CatDescriptText: Mr. John A. (Jack) Adams, 939 Kirkbride Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Sherman Adams was guilty of misconduct in the office of assistant to the President? Do you think that he should have resigned?" answer reads: "Sherman Adams has not been proven guilty of any misdemeanor in office and therefore he is presumed to be innocent until proved guilty by a jury of his peers.  However, when it looked like his case would be embarrassing to our illustrious General and President of our great country, I think that he should have immediately quit."
TitMainTitle: John A. "Jack" Adams wearing eyeglasses, striped suit and leaf patterned necktie with clip, standing with Courier reporter in front of Allegheny County Courthouse, Downtown
